citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An bottle of 10% Acetylcysteine was identified with an expiration date of September 1, 2022. Use of expired medications
does not constitute the standard of care and can potentially cause adverse effects to the animals. Medications must be
properly disposed of before the expiration date is reached. The medication was disposed of at the time of inspection.
*********Corrected at the time of inspection
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by 60 days counted from 1st RL Inspection or the applicant
will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-
License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An bottle of 10% Acetylcysteine was identified with an expiration date of September 1, 2022. Use of expired medications 
does not constitute the standard of care and can potentially cause adverse effects to the animals. Medications must be 
properly disposed of before the expiration date is reached. The medication was disposed of at the time of inspection.  
*********Corrected at the time of inspection 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2  more inspection(s) or by 60 days counted from 1st RL Inspection or the applicant 
will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-
License Inspection. 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
End Section
